title: CALLING ALL GAME MASTERS: D&D 5e Encounter Wanted
snippet:
What's up DMs?

I'm looking to have a generic D&D encounter created that I can use as the basis for a new collection of GM-centered resources. This is Part One of what is meant to be an ongoing project with a larger scope.

Here are my parameters:

-The encounter should be suitable for a level 3 party

-Be set in a non-specific location that most GMs would be able to work into their campaign

-Use monsters that are common across most settings, or else are easily modified by the GM for their setting if their campaign is specialized

-No NPCs or plotpoints that are anchored to a specific story line/campaign (rather, the encounter should fit easily into other GMs' stories)

-MUST Follow the guidelines set out by the Wizards of the Coast Open Gaming License for D&D 5e (available here: http://media.wizards.com/2016/downloads/DND/SRD-OGL_V5.1.pdf). The most common concern is with the Product Identity items on page one, paragraph four-- don't use any of those terms.

-Must not be previously published anywhere else, original material only.

-Must be a single encounter where the action is resolved when the players have killed all monsters, left the area, etc. Save your creativity, dungeon crawls, and multi-part encounters for later on.

-There must be combat involved.

In terms of areas to cover in the material, here are the general sections (please also see the attachments for an example):

Encounter level (and is it scales up or down, the range of the encounter)
Terrain type
Races, classes, and/or feats that have advantage in this encounter
Races, classes, and/or feats that have disadvantage in this encounter
How hard the encounter would be
Creatures Summary & Profiles
Rewards Summary
Creature tactics/behavior
Suggestions for scaling the adventure up or down to accommodate different PC levels or party sizes

In terms of length, I only expect it to be complete in terms of giving a GM what they need to use the encounter. I prefer short and functional to long and flowery.

If you have any questions or clarifications, I'm happy to answer as best I can.

Thanks!
